channel.title: Free the Geek.fm - The podcast about building a rewarding career as a professional software developer.
channel.description: A fortnightly, fireside chat, on the ins and outs of building a rewarding career as a professional software developer. Looking at what it's like to do it, warts and all, as well as how to get started, what to expect, the good, the bad, and the ugly.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The podcast about building a rewarding career as a professional software developer.

item.title: Episode 21 - Talking With Dan Allen Asciidoc Project Lead
item.description: In this episode I sit down with Asciidoc project Lead, and all round good fella - Dan Allen. If you love technical writing, technical documentation, and documenting your code, then this is an episode you're not going to want to miss.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I sit down with Asciidoc project Lead, and all round good fella - Dan Allen. If you love technical writing, technical documentation, and documenting your code, then this is an episode you’re not going to want to miss.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I sit down with Asciidoc project Lead, and all round good fella - Dan Allen. If you love technical writing, technical documentation, and documenting your code, then this is an episode you’re not going to want to miss.

item.title: Episode 20 - Talking About Finding Balance As A Freelancer
item.description: In this episode we pick up where we left off in [episode 19](/episode/episode-0019), with a slight segway. But, instead of starting to look at how to use Twitter, and other social media tools, let's talk about something more important.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode we pick up where we left off in [episode 19](/episode/episode-0019), with a slight segway. But, instead of starting to look at how to use Twitter, and other social media tools, let’s talk about something more important.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we pick up where we left off in [episode 19](/episode/episode-0019), with a slight segway. But, instead of starting to look at how to use Twitter, and other social media tools, let’s talk about something more important.

item.title: Episode 19 - Talking Trump, Brexit, and Getting Started as a Freelancer
item.description: In this episode I decided to go a little off track and have a bit of a rant, a bit of an "letting go" session in light of the recent US election and Brexit. I'm no fan of either, and I share why in the first half of the episode.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I decided to go a little off track and have a bit of a rant, a bit of an “letting go” session in light of the recent US election and Brexit. I’m no fan of either, and I share why in the first half of the episode.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I decided to go a little off track and have a bit of a rant, a bit of an “letting go” session in light of the recent US election and Brexit. I’m no fan of either, and I share why in the first half of the episode.

item.title: Episode 18 - Talking Conferences and Mental Health with Matthew Turland
item.description: In this episode I wonderful chat with Matthew Turland about what it's like speaking at conferences and mental health - especially within the IT community.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I wonderful chat with Matthew Turland about what it’s like speaking at conferences and mental health - especially within the IT community.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I wonderful chat with Matthew Turland about what it’s like speaking at conferences and mental health - especially within the IT community.

item.title: Episode 17 - Talking Conferences and Security with Chris Cornutt
item.description: In this episode I chat with Chris Cornutt, founder of PHPDeveloper.org, websec.io, and Lone Star PHP about conferences and all things security.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I chat with Chris Cornutt, founder of PHPDeveloper.org, websec.io, and Lone Star PHP about conferences and all things security.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I chat with Chris Cornutt, founder of PHPDeveloper.org, websec.io, and Lone Star PHP about conferences and all things security.

item.title: Episode 16 - Talking Testing and Building YOUR Dream with Chris Hartjes
item.description: In this episode I chat with Chris Hartjes, the Grumpy Programmer himself, about the ins and outs of testing and what it's like to spend part of your working week building your dreams, instead of someone else's.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I chat with Chris Hartjes, the Grumpy Programmer himself, about the ins and outs of testing and what it’s like to spend part of your working week building your dreams, instead of someone else’s.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I chat with Chris Hartjes, the Grumpy Programmer himself, about the ins and outs of testing and what it’s like to spend part of your working week building your dreams, instead of someone else’s.

item.title: Episode 15 - Talking Sunshine PHP, Project Estimates, and Conferences with Adam Culp
item.description: In this episode I chat with Adam Culp, founder of the Sunshine PHP, in sunny south Florida, about starting and running conferences, project estimates, and being professional developers.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I chat with Adam Culp, founder of the Sunshine PHP, in sunny south Florida, about starting and running conferences, project estimates, and being professional developers.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I chat with Adam Culp, founder of the Sunshine PHP, in sunny south Florida, about starting and running conferences, project estimates, and being professional developers.

item.title: Episode 14 - Talking Slim 3, PSR-7, Constraints & Decisions with Rob Allen
item.description: In this episode I have a fireside chat with sagely Rob Allen, about being one of the leads on the Slim 3 project, and about the constraints and decisions developers need to make.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I have a fireside chat with sagely Rob Allen, about being one of the leads on the Slim 3 project, and about the constraints and decisions developers need to make.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I have a fireside chat with sagely Rob Allen, about being one of the leads on the Slim 3 project, and about the constraints and decisions developers need to make.

item.title: Episode 13 - Talking Nomad PHP, Laravel, and Conferences with Joe P. Ferguson
item.description: In this episode I have a fireside chat with the voice of Nomad PHP, Joe P. Ferguson. Joe shares how he got started as the voice of Nomad PHP.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I have a fireside chat with the voice of Nomad PHP, Joe P. Ferguson. Joe shares how he got started as the voice of Nomad PHP.

item.title: Episode 12 - Talking about the Magic of TDD and Testing with Tom Oram
item.description: In this episode I have a fireside chat about all things TDD and testing with the sagely Mr Tom Oram, otherwise known as @tomphp.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I have a fireside chat about all things TDD and testing with the sagely Mr Tom Oram, otherwise known as @tomphp.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode I have a fireside chat about all things TDD and testing with the sagely Mr Tom Oram, otherwise known as @tomphp.

item.title: Episode 11 - The Life of a Developer Evangelist, with Developer Jack
item.description: In this episode I have a fireside chat about what it's like to live the life of a developer evangelist with Jack Skinner, otherwise known as @developerjack, whilst he was at the first BuzzConf.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I have a fireside chat about what it's like to live the life of a developer evangelist with Jack Skinner, otherwise known as @developerjack, whilst he was at the first BuzzConf.

item.title: Episode 10 - Talking Shop with Stephan Hochdoerfer
item.description: In this episode I have a fireside chat about a range of topics with Stephan Hochdoerfer.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode I have a fireside chat about a range of topics with Stephan Hochdoerfer.

item.title: Episode 9 - Removing False Perceptions About People, The Roland R-05, and Zend Expressive
item.description: There's no guests in this episode. Instead I explore a range of topics, including one quite dear to me - how we can build up preconceptions of what other people think of us.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: There's no guests in this episode. Instead I explore a range of topics, including one quite dear to me - how we can build up preconceptions of what other people think of us.
item.itunes:summary: There's no guests in this episode. Instead I explore a range of topics, including one quite dear to me - how we can build up preconceptions of what other people think of us.

item.title: Talking Technical Writing and Simplifying Deployment with Erika Heidi
item.description: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with the wonderful Erika Heidi, where we talk about technical writing. We also talk about simplifying deployment, naturally, with her preferred tools of Vagrant and Ansible.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with the wonderful Erika Heidi, where we talk about technical writing. We also talk about simplifying deployment, naturally, with her preferred tools of Vagrant and Ansible.

item.title: How to be an Exceptional Public Speaker, and Blogging for the Long Term with Troy Hunt
item.description: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with Troy Hunt. Troy's a Microsoft MVP for Security, PluralSight author, and public speaker.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with Troy Hunt. Troy's a Microsoft MVP for Security, PluralSight author, and public speaker.

item.title: Building Your Brand as a Freelancer - with Gary Hockin (Part Two)
item.description: In this episode, I have, part two of, a fireside chat with, Zend Framework aficionado and Roave stalwart, Gary Hockin about the ins and outs of building both a brand and a reputation as a freelancer.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, I have, part two of, a fireside chat with, Zend Framework aficionado and Roave stalwart, Gary Hockin about the ins and outs of building both a brand and a reputation as a freelancer.

item.title: Wisdom as a Service World Tour and Human Skills - with Yitzchok Willroth
item.description: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with Yitzchok Willroth, the one and only [coderabbi](https://twitter.com/@coderabbi), about a his [Wisdom as a Service World Tour](http://wisdomworldtour.com/).

item.title: Being a Professional Developer - with Cal Evans
item.description: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with voice of the PHP community, the one and only, [Cal Evans](http://blog.calevans.com/), about one of his books - [Going Pro](https://leanpub.com/goingpro).
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)

item.title: The Mythical Man Month with Paul M. Jones & Speaking Engagements
item.description: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with internationally recognized PHP expert, and all around good fella Paul M. Jones, about one of his all-time favorite books - The Mythical Man Month.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with internationally recognized PHP expert, and all around good fella Paul M. Jones, about one of his all-time favorite books - The Mythical Man Month.

item.title: Getting Underway, The E-Myth Revisited, and Networking For Success
item.description: In this, the first episode, Matt talks about what lead to the podcast getting started who motivated him and inspired him to get started. After that, he discusses a fantastic book that all freelancers should read.
item.author: matthew@freethegeek.fm (FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter)
